options.title: -S
options.description: Change and report the soft limit associated with a resource.

options.title: -H
options.description: Change and report the hard limit associated with a resource.

options.title: -a
options.description: All current limits are reported; no limits are set.

options.title: -b
options.description: The maximum socket buffer size.

options.title: -c
options.description: The maximum size of core files created.

options.title: -d
options.description: The maximum size of a processâ€™s data segment.

options.title: -e
options.description: The maximum scheduling priority ("nice").

options.title: -f
options.description: The maximum size of files written by the shell and its children.

options.title: -i
options.description: The maximum number of pending signals.

options.title: -k
options.description: The maximum number of kqueues that may be allocated.

options.title: -l
options.description: The maximum size that may be locked into memory.

options.title: -m
options.description: The maximum resident set size (many systems do not honor this limit).

options.title: -n
options.description: The maximum number of open file descriptors (most systems do not allow this value to be set).

options.title: -p
options.description: The pipe buffer size.

options.title: -q
options.description: The maximum number of bytes in POSIX message queues.

options.title: -r
options.description: The maximum real-time scheduling priority.

options.title: -s
options.description: The maximum stack size.

options.title: -t
options.description: The maximum amount of cpu time in seconds.

options.title: -u
options.description: The maximum number of processes available to a single user.

options.title: -v
options.description: The maximum amount of virtual memory available to the shell, and, on some systems, to its children.

options.title: -x
options.description: The maximum number of file locks.

options.title: -P
options.description: The maximum number of pseudoterminals.

options.title: -R
options.description: The maximum time a real-time process can run before blocking, in microseconds.

options.title: -T
options.description: The maximum number of threads.
